domain_guidance:
When evaluating motor skills, pay special attention to:
- The quality and consistency of movement patterns
- Whether physical assistance is needed
- Environmental adaptations that support the skill
- The child's ability to generalize the skill across contexts
- Any physical limitations that might affect performance

category_descriptions.cannot_do_desc: Child shows no evidence of the motor skill or makes no attempts
category_descriptions.with_support_desc: Child performs the motor skill with physical assistance or environmental modifications
category_descriptions.emerging_desc: Child is beginning to show the motor skill but is inconsistent or partial
category_descriptions.independent_desc: Child performs the motor skill consistently without help across contexts
category_descriptions.lost_skill_desc: Child previously demonstrated the motor skill but has regressed or lost the ability
